messages.message:
I'm working on getting launcher to work for public repos, and right now I'm not able to retrieve the databases and drives for a public repo because authentication fails. Here's the handler for drives that I'm using: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/handler/api/v1/drive.py#L56

How do I make it so that this doesn't fail for public repos?
Authentication token not found. Please provide a valid auth token.
Sounds like it works as designed - the reason it worked before was because we weren't loading the drives this way, from the api
We were just passing the drives into the page via context
oh i see. interesting, i’m actually not sure how internal calls via our API works. But externally you should have to generate and add an auth token to the request
@dlluncor can you shed some light on how this works?
hey Jessica, you’re trying list drives via AJAX for public repos (when the user is signed out)?

so if in fact you are trying to do an AJAX request to list drives, we might have to consider decorators = [allow_public_access] in the backend if we do in fact what non-logged in users to be able to access our API
Yup that's right! so that would make it so that for public repos only, logged out users could reach the api?
ya…let me chat with Heymian + infra team on what kind of solution we want here
The work to fix this is being tracked here: https://app.asana.com/0/465776099085358/1115860960556854
